info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 28 at 9:35AM MST until February 28 at 10:00AM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: The National Weather Service in Grand Junction has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... West central Delta County in west central Colorado... Central Mesa County in west central Colorado... South central Garfield County in west central Colorado... * Until 1000 AM MST. * At 934 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Parachute to 8 miles east of Palisade to 28 miles northwest of Nucla, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to one- quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 50 mph could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 77 and 105. U.S. Highway 50 in Colorado between mile markers 42 and 61. Colorado 13 between mile markers 1 and 4. Colorado 65 between mile markers 15 and 57. Colorado 141 between mile markers 103 and 104, and between mile markers 132 and 151, and near mile marker 154. Locations impacted include... Rifle, New Castle, Silt, Collbran, Mesa, Battlement Mesa, Skyway, Plateau City, Molina, Grand Mesa and Whitewater. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
